snippet: Secretary General Ban Ki-moon said the review panel was meant to “ensure that the United Nations does not fail the victims of sexual abuse.”
abstract: United Nations announces it will create independent panel to investigate allegations by New York-based advocacy group AIDS-Free World that French peacekeepers sexually abused children in Central African Republic.

byline.contributor: Nick Cumming-Bruce contributed reporting from Geneva.

lead_paragraph: Secretary General Ban Ki-moon said the review panel was meant to “ensure that the United Nations does not fail the victims of sexual abuse.”

headline.main: U.N. Creating Panel to Review Handling of African Children Sex Abuse Inquiry
headline.print_headline: U.N. Panel to Review Response to Abuses

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: United Nations Department of Peacekeeping Operations
